newsitem.title: BRAZIL: RESEARCH ALERT-Telebras still a Salomon buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Telebras still a Salomon buy.

text.p: Salomon Brothers said Tuesday it was maintaining its buy rating on Telebras based on the upcoming privatization and liberalization of Brazil's telecommunications sector.

-- "We believe the government will strive to create a stable environment and begin a liberalization process that allows fair competition, thereby maximizing shareholder value," Salomon analyst Sari Mayer said in a report.
-- She said the initial phase of the restructuring of the Telebras system into five regional operating companies should be under way by the beginning of 1998.
-- "By the end of 1998, Embratel and Telesp should be fully privatized and preparing for competition," she added.

-- Brazil's entire telecom system should be liberalized by the end of the century, "with domestic and international operators competing in each market and Telebras shareholders as well as the Brazilian government richer," Mayer said.
-- Telebras preferred was off 0.34 percent at 148.20 reais, while its common stock was down 0.64 percent at 139.10 reais at 1512 local/1812 GMT.
